text: <extra_id_0> TRAMP <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , a novel apoptosis - mediating receptor with sequence homology to <extra_id_0> tumor necrosis factor receptor 1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> Fas <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> Apo-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> CD95 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) .
A novel member of the tumor necrosis factor ( TNF ) receptor family , designated <extra_id_0> TRAMP <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , has been identified .
The structural organization of the 393 amino acid long human <extra_id_0> TRAMP <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is most homologous to <extra_id_0> TNF receptor 1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .
<extra_id_0> TRAMP <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is abundantly expressed on thymocytes and lymphocytes .
Its extracellular domain is composed of four cysteine-rich domains , and the cytoplasmic region contains a death domain known to signal apoptosis .
Overexpression of <extra_id_0> TRAMP <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> leads to two major responses , NF-kappaB activation and apoptosis .
<extra_id_0> TRAMP <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - induced cell death is inhibited by an inhibitor of ICE-like proteases , but not by <extra_id_0> Bcl-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .
In addition , <extra_id_0> TRAMP <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> does not appear to interact with any of the known apoptosis - inducing ligands of the TNF family .
